items.content_html:
Summary

Spotted while reviewing the specification for system colors – all of the other colors are in sync between the spec and MDN, although the order is different. The description I added is inspired by that of ButtonFace and ButtonText.

Motivation

Documentation on MDN should match specifications.

Supporting details

  • CSS Color Module Level 4 – 6.2. System Colors.

I couldn’t find any existing issue relating to "ButtonBorder".
items.title: Add missing CSS Color Module Level 4 system color: ButtonBorder

items.content_html: This PR removes the documentation for the RTCConfiguration dictionary, folding its data into the RTCPeerConnection constructor page. Correlates with removal work in BCD, see mdn/browser-compat-data#12830.
items.title: Remove RTCConfiguration dictionary from MDN

items.content_html:
This PR prepares the Web/Progressive_Web_Apps docs (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps) for Markdowning.

After this there are 0 unconverted elements.

I've deleted https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Progressive_web_apps/Responsive/Media_types and made it redirect to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Media_Queries/Using_media_queries.

I have to say though, these docs are pretty depressing.
items.title: [Markdown][Web/Progressive_Web_Apps] Prepare Web/Progressive_Web_Apps for Markdowning

items.content_html:
Summary

Corrected fragment identifier in link.

Motivation

The link was broken. Following the advice of MDN issue #3607, I pointed the anchor link at the closest heading rather than adding a hardcoded id attribute to the dt element.

Supporting details

id attributes in the JavaScript documentation

Related issues

items.title: Fix broken link

items.content_html:
Summary

Simpler code example:

  • No need to splice
  • Params can come directly from the URL.

Motivation

  1. (I love the MDN docs and I would like to contribute!)
  2. I feel like this example is a much more realistic example, and it explains the same search parameter can appear twice, and that this is what getAll is for.

Supporting details

items.title: Simpler `URLSearchParams.getAll` example

items.content_html:
Summary

Both "OK" and "okay" are acceptable. Replaced instance of "ok" with "OK".

Motivation

It is grammatically correct and maintains some consistency.

Supporting details

https://www.quickanddirtytips.com/education/grammar/ok-okay
https://www.grammarly.com/blog/ok-okay/
https://grammarist.com/spelling/ok-okay/

Related issues

items.content_html:

  • Fix example value of Intl.DateTimeFormat() with options : {month: "numeric" || "2-digit"} to match the flow of document explanation

Motivation

Open-Source Contribution

items.content_html:
Fixes #9732

This originally said the fill() was filling with random values, but what they mean is "an arbitrary value I chose".
This makes it clear that the array is populated with the specified value.
items.title: Array.fill() does not populate with random values

items.content_html:
Summary

Rewritten some sentences and replaced pronouns like 'it' to improve the clarity of the content. Hopefully, the technical accuracy of the page is still intact after the changes.

There is scope to improve the content further (like more examples can be added and some sections can be rewritten). I can take that up if I can work with a subject matter expert to resolve the gaps.

Motivation

Edited this page as part of "Writing Day" during the Write the Docs Prague 2021 conference: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Vary
items.title: Edits and rewrites to improve clarity

items.content_html:
Summary

This change removes the mention of String.replace in the JS doc for Array

Motivation

The discussion of array creation from RegExp in the Array doc mentions that arrays might be returned from String.replace. But String.replace returns a string, instead of an array. Although a string is an array like object, it's technically very different from the array that is being discussed in this particular context:

This array has properties and elements which provide information about the match.

Supporting details

Related issues

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Fix Array JS doc: remove String.replace from RegExp discussion

items.content_html:
Preparation PR: #9719

Conversion report summary:

All unhandled elements

  • th (10)
  • tr (4)
  • td (4)
  • table (2)
  • table.standard-table (2)

Full conversion report: https://gist.github.com/wbamberg/b0538d562f31e9350c9bc1690e7e9fde

The only unconverted elements are four tables, none of which can be represented in GFM.
items.title: [Markdown][Plugins] Convert Plugins to Markdown - DO NOT SQUASH MERGE

items.content_html: This PR removes the documentation for the EffectTiming API to go along with its removal in BCD, see mdn/browser-compat-data#12765. Additionally, this PR cleans up the remnants of the KeyframeEffectOptions dictionary.
items.title: Remove EffectTiming and KeyframeEffectOptions from MDN

items.content_html:
This PR is a proof-of-concept to show what it would look like if we were to separate the pages for methods in both WebGL 1 and 2 into their own pages, to go along with updates in BCD (see mdn/browser-compat-data#12103). This PR demonstrates the concept using the bufferData method.

CC @foolip @Elchi3
items.title: Separate documentation for WebGL 1 and 2 methods/properties

items.content_html:
Summary

I ported the code over from the blog post that I believe this references and is referenced to in the section directly below so that the live example would be working as expected.

Motivation

Currently the example found in the MutationObserver article (https://codepen.io/webgeeker/full/YjrZgg/) doesn't work; instead of resizing, it maintains the same size and will show a scroll bar when the size of the contenteditable list exceeds the initial size.
